meanings.definition: Take (a position of power or importance) illegally or by force.
meanings.sent1: The villain was usurping control of the kingdom from the rightful king.
meanings.sent2: The dictator was accused of usurping authority from the government.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was usurping the title of 'king of the forest'.
meanings.sent4: The ambitious employee was usurping the manager's role in the office hierarchy.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds were usurping the sky, blocking out the sun's rays.

meanings.definition: Seize (a throne, power, etc.) without legal right.
meanings.sent1: The rebel army was usurping the throne from the royal family.
meanings.sent2: The invaders were accused of usurping control of the land from the indigenous people.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon was usurping the title of 'chief garbage collector'.
meanings.sent4: The ambitious student was usurping the top spot in the class rankings.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog was usurping the visibility on the road, causing accidents.
